Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
Company Background

Small Art Ltd., established on March 1, 2018, is headquartered in the British Virgin Islands (BVI). The company specializes in the creation, collection, and trading of small-scale artworks. Founded by a group of art enthusiasts, Small Art Ltd. aims to integrate art into modern life through innovative methods, allowing more people to experience the charm of miniature art. Focused on combining traditional and digital art, the company strives to drive the globalization of the small-scale art market.

Core Business

1.Miniature Art Creation and Customization Services
•Offers bespoke miniature paintings, sculptures, and jewelry designs, especially for collectors and high-end clients.
•Collaborates with renowned artists to release limited-edition miniature art pieces.

2.Art Digitalization
•Employs blockchain technology to provide clients with digital asset solutions for miniature art, ensuring authenticity and uniqueness.
•Operates an online art trading platform, enabling global clients to browse and purchase artworks conveniently.

3.Art Exhibitions and Education
•Organizes annual miniature art tours in major cities worldwide.
•Launches “Miniature Art Academy,” featuring online courses and offline workshops to promote art education.
4.Investment Consulting Services
•Offers valuation and investment advisory services for collectors and investors, particularly in the niche field of miniature art.

Development Milestones

•2018: Focused on art trading services in the British Virgin Islands and neighboring regions during its early stages.
•2019: Introduced digital technologies, enabling the digitization of artworks and the launch of NFT-based art trading, expanding its influence.
•2020: Expanded into Asian and European markets, unveiling an online miniature art education platform that attracted over 100,000 registered students.
•2022: Partnered with leading international art institutions to host the “World Miniature Art Expo,” which garnered over 500,000 attendees.

Future Vision

Small Art Ltd. aims to become a global leader in miniature art innovation by combining art and technology. The company seeks to make artworks more accessible while fostering cultural exchange on a global scale.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
1.Digitized Art Data
Our miniature artworks are converted into high-resolution images, 3D models, and metadata (including descriptions, creation background, and artist information) using advanced scanning and digitization technologies. This ensures that the artworks can be showcased and traded globally while their authenticity and uniqueness are safeguarded through blockchain technology.
2.NFT Metadata for Artworks
Small Art Ltd. frequently develops NFTs corresponding to our miniature art pieces. We store the metadata for these NFTs (e.g., artwork name, creator, creation date, and unique identifiers) along with the digital files of the artworks on Filecoin. This ensures their immutability and long-term preservation.
3.Educational Content and Teaching Materials
Our “Miniature Art Classroom” generates extensive educational resources, such as video courses, instructional demonstrations, artist interviews, and related materials. These resources are stored on the Filecoin network, making them accessible to global users anytime.
4.Exhibition and Event Records
Recordings, images, and documentation from Small Art Ltd.’s global miniature art exhibitions are securely stored for future reference and promotional purposes. These large, valuable files are well-suited for long-term storage on the Filecoin network.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
1.Digital Artworks Data Preparation
•Data Collection: We use high-precision scanners (such as Phase One or Fujifilm’s high-end scanners) to capture high-resolution images of miniature artworks. For 3D artworks, we use 3D scanners (such as Artec Eva) to generate high-precision 3D models.
•Data Formats: The scanned artwork images are saved in high-resolution JPEG or TIFF formats, while 3D models are saved in STL or OBJ formats. Additionally, each artwork is accompanied by metadata, such as artwork title, creation background, and artist information, which are stored in JSON format.
•Processing Tools: During image and 3D model processing, we use tools such as Adobe Photoshop and Blender for editing and optimization to ensure the quality of images and the detail of models.
2.NFT Metadata Preparation
•NFT Metadata Generation: Each artwork is associated with an NFT, and corresponding metadata is generated, including artwork title, author, creation date, and unique identifier. We use smart contract platforms (such as Ethereum or Filecoin-supported NFT standards) to mint NFTs and store their metadata in IPFS (InterPlanetary File System) or directly on Filecoin.
•Smart Contract Tools: We use the Truffle framework and Solidity to write smart contracts for minting and managing NFTs.
3.Educational Content and Teaching Material Preparation
•Video Courses and Educational Materials: All courses and teaching materials (e.g., videos, PPTs, PDF files) are edited and organized. We use Adobe Premiere and Final Cut Pro for video editing, and Microsoft PowerPoint or Keynote for course presentation creation. PDF files are converted into formats suitable for storage and transmission.
•Storage and Management: All educational content is stored on the Filecoin network, with integrated Filecoin APIs and IPFS used for data uploading and management, ensuring the long-term storage and security of the content.
4.Artwork Exhibitions and Event Records Preparation
•Image and Photo Organization: Photos and videos of artwork exhibitions and event records are selected and optimized. We use Photoshop and DaVinci Resolve to process the footage to ensure the best visual quality.
•Storage and Archiving: These large files (e.g., videos and high-resolution images) are uploaded to Filecoin for long-term storage, leveraging Filecoin’s distributed storage capabilities to ensure future access and promotional use.
